column4: linux says my NIC MAC address is invalid, likely due to a known issue with it being read backwards.  Due to this I get assigned a random MAC and an incremented ethXX device number every time I reboot.  Is there some way to avoid that?
its built into my motherboard, and it worked fine for years.  up until about gutsy
check the bug report on the card, push it forward if it's been broken for that long
